Description: Fragment of neck, complete round handle and shoulder from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay medium, brick red; yellowish slip.. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Vehilius. cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 170. P. Palazzo, Le anfore di Apani (Brindisi), Rome 2013, 74, F4. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 31, 34.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1292)
